intro: Sphaeralcea fendleri var. tripartita, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually lobed and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is part of the Malvaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
